message:
{
    "name": "Brinkmann metric in General Relativity",
    "abbrev": "brinkmannMetric",
    "description": "The Brinkmann metric is a solution to the Einstein field equations, describing a spacetime with a non-trivial topology. It is a toy model for testing gravitational lensing effects and the bending of light around massive objects.",
    "defined": true,
    "derived": true,
    "signature": [-1, -1, -1],
    "dimensions": 4,
    "charts": [
        {
            "chartName": "BrinkmannChart",
            "xlineElement": "-dtds^2 + 2e^(-r)dt^2 + (1 + r/2)e^(r)dr^2 + r^2dΩ^2",
            "validated": false,
        }
    ],
    "desiredProperties": ["christoffels", "ricci", "riemann", "einstein", "weyl", "g00", "infiniteRedShift", "horizons", "singularities", "limits"]
}[0m
